column1: #Text=[0006]Another type of document collaboration tool, such as WebX or LiveMeeting, enables web collaboration via a centralized conference server deployed on the Internet.

#Text=If the host is presenting a document on his/her PC, then the document collaboration tool converts the format of the document to an image format that can be recognized by a browser (i.e., Internet Explorer) on the other participant's PCs.
#Text=For example, the LiveMeeting tool converts documents to a Live Meeting format (.lmp).
#Text=The document collaboration tool then uploads the converted document to the conference server.
#Text=The other participants may then view the document through their browser on their PCs over the Internet.
#Text=[0007]There are problems providing online collaboration in this manner.
#Text=First, by converting the documents to image files, moving picture content (e.g., PPT customized animation, moving GIF, etc) cannot be displayed to the other participants.
#Text=Secondly, there is an increased risk of the important business secrets being disclosed because these documents are uploaded and shared via public internet access.
#Text=Third, the quality of the conference voice and video can't be guaranteed when transmitting over the Internet.

#Text=[0008]Some online conference tools also provide dedicated equipment to mix the collaboration data into the conference voice path to share among the participants' PCs, such as Polycom's "Voice+Content" solution.
#Text=Unfortunately, this solution requires that each conference location has this dedicated equipment installed and connected to the conference endpoints.
#Text=Using this dedicated equipment can be costly to install, and can be inconvenient as the participants have to gather in a location where the dedicated equipment is installed.
#Text=[0009]The invention solves the above and other related problems with improved online conferencing systems and methods.
